body_html:
afaik we don't support non-pytorch objects as arguments to autograd Functions. The fact that we support numpy arrays is because those are upcasted to tensors.

For this, we should probably guard against non-pytorch objects as inputs to autograd Functions.

cc @apaszke

afaik we don't support non-pytorch objects as arguments to autograd Functions. The fact that we support numpy arrays is because those are upcasted to tensors.
For this, we should probably guard against non-pytorch objects as inputs to autograd Functions.
cc @apaszke
body:
afaik we don't support non-pytorch objects as arguments to autograd Functions. The fact that we support numpy arrays is because those are upcasted to tensors.

For this, we should probably guard against non-pytorch objects as inputs to autograd Functions.

cc @apaszke
